inference:
The octahedron has 12 edges. There are $\binom82=28$ ways to choose 2 vertices from 8 vertices.  So, the probability that the two chosen vertices are the endpoints of an edge of the octahedron is
$$\frac{12}{28} = \frac{3}{7}.$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{\frac{3}{7}}$. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: Because the octahedron is symmetric and all vertices have the same number of edges, we can assume that the first vertex we choose is the top one. If we do not choose this vertex, we can simply rotate the octahedron so that we have. From here, there are 5 other vertices. 4 of them share an edge with the vertex we have already chosen, so the probability that the 2 vertices chosen form an edge is $\boxed{\frac{4}{5}}$.

ground_truth: Because the octahedron is symmetric and all vertices have the same number of edges, we can assume that the first vertex we choose is the top one. If we do not choose this vertex, we can simply rotate the octahedron so that we have.
